numbered_ace_sentences: 2. Many applicants apply to a prestigious institution.
3. Wealthy applicants have a better probability of being admitted to a prestigious institution.
4. The graph shows an average admittance rate.
5. The graph shows that the poorest applicants have about a 3-times higher probability than the average admittance rate.
6. The graph shows that the richest applicants have about a 7-times higher probability than the average admittance rate.
7. The author asks whether wealth influences admission more than test scores.
8. The author asks whether wealth influences admission more than results.
9. The author lives in a city.
10. The average poverty percentage in the city is 19.69%.
11. This situation applies to the author's neighborhood.
12. The author says that a person who is involved in an elite college has a lower probability of being accepted than a wealthier person.
